newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks take breather, but Telefonica climbs.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks take breather, but Telefonica climbs.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed lower on Thursday, consolidating Wednesday's huge rise amid profit-taking, although Telefonica and Iberdrola continued higher regardless.
The general index shed 4.00 points, 0.71 percent, to 556.10 and the Ibex-35 fell 46.81 points, 0.73 percent, to 6,402.20.
Telefonica added 50 pesetas to 4,270 and Iberdrola rose 25 pesetas to 1,820.
BBV saw profit-taking, dropping 250 pesetas to 10,090, as did Endesa which shed 130 pesetas to 11,210.

"Today's performance is good for the market trend, because accumulated gains are very strong and at some point sellers will have to come out to take profits, although at any point we could start rising again," said one trader.
But a second said that sellers only came out of one stock to buy into another, such was the optimism behind the trend.
"People in general are moving on gut feeling. If they think that a stock's getting hot, they buy and don't ask any questions," said a dealer at a Spanish bank.
